The '''Mathom-house''' was a museum-like building in [[Michel Delving]] where the [[Hobbits]] collected and displayed "[[mathoms]]": items and trinkets for which they had no particular use. It was known to contain a store of [[:Category:Weapons|weapons]],<ref>{{FR|Hobbits}}, p. 5</ref> and for a time also (between {{TA|2941}} and {{TA|3001}}) it held [[Bilbo Baggins]]' [[Mithril-coat]].<ref>{{FR|Finding}},p 13</ref><ref>{{H|Stage}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
===The Mathom-house in adaptations===
<gallery mode="traditional" widths="250px" heights="150px">
File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Mathom-house.jpg|''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]''
</gallery>
'''2007: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The Mathom-house is a reputation-restricted area. Players have to complete several quests for [[Hobbits]] of [[The Shire]] and turn the [[mathom]]s given to them was rewards to "The Mathom Society" before they are recognized for their efforts and allowed entry. Inside, various curiousities can be browsed and some of them purchased.
